title: Work - v from graph of F vs x

content.description: A <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> object can move on a straight, horizontal track with negligible friction. The object is initially at rest at position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math>, when a horizontal force is exerted on the object. The force is measured as a function of the objectâ€™s position, and the data are shown in the graph.
content.question: What is the speed of the object when the object is at position <math alttext="x equals 2.0 meters" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi> </math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
